intro: Echidnopsis specksii, commonly known as the speckled stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, adapting it to arid environments. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or white. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Echidnopsis specksii is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and requires minimal water once established.
